title: Chemistry: Atoms and Molecules

vocab.definition: The smallest unit of an element that retains the element's properties
Two or more atoms bonded together
The force that holds atoms together in compounds
A chart that organizes elements by their atomic number and properties

teachingNotes: Use molecular models and periodic table exploration. Demonstrate simple chemical reactions. Connect to atomic theory and conservation of mass.

sample.question: What is the difference between an atom and a molecule?
expectedAny: atom is single element unit, molecule is multiple atoms bonded
atoms are building blocks, molecules are compounds
atom is one, molecule is bonded atoms

truefalse.question: All molecules contain atoms from different elements.
expectedAny: molecules can be made of same element, like O₂

multiplechoice.question: How many atoms are in one molecule of water (H₂O)?

fillintheblank.question: In the compound CO₂, there is _____ carbon atom and _____ oxygen atoms.

shortanswer.question: Explain why the periodic table is organized the way it is.
expectedAny: elements with similar properties are grouped together
